peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much does it cost to get antique jewelry appraised?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Costs can range from about $50 to $75 per item, or $50 to $150 or more per hour, depending on the appraisal's items.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How to Value Jewelry Inherited From a Loved One - Investopedia

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I get my jewelry appraised?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Step 1: Go to the National Association of Jewelry Appraisers, click on the FIND AN APPRAISER button and put in your zip code. Step 2: Make sure that person is a GEMOLOGIST by seeing GG or FGA after their name. Step 3: Make sure the appraiser you hire has experience appraising the items you need to be appraised.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Where to find a Jewelry Appraiser - YouTube

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Will a jeweler appraise for free?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Can You Get a Free Jewelry Appraisal? Yes, getting free jewelry appraisals from local and reputable jewelers is possible. It should include the replacement value you might expect to receive if you buy it now. However, free appraisals won't give you an objective report.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Where to Get Jewelry Appraised for Free - Everything You Should Know
